channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Out of hours received - 11/10/2025 10:23:12 ref 864363, 13th October
item.description:
Dead cat in callers back garden - caller doesn't own a cat and decomposing of the cat has started. Advised caller of procedure, however caller concerned re foxes if left out the front in bags as they have a fox issue. Caller would like to make Main office aware, she will leave the cat bagged and place in the black box with lid on (due to pest control) out of the front of the property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Framlingham Crescent, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dogs using this area for fouling, 13th October
item.description:
Its fine most of the estate now has dogs, bu this area is not a fouling area, its such a shame seeing the kid kneeling playing here at weekends after the dogs have fouled and weed here, its heartbreaking to see, after living here for many years, this is the largest dog population I have seen here, we really need this sign please, the grass is now patchy, and brown. Some owners are not picking up the mess either.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72-68, Courtlands Avenue, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous blocked cycle lane, 13th October
item.description:
Monday 13th October 08:00 - URGENT concern regarding Melford Road cycle lane Temporary traffic lights at the junction/roundabout at Melford Road/Underhill Road includes a cycle lane closure. No warning along Melford Road cycle lane, which goes in the opposite direction to the one-way flow of traffic from Lordship Lane, that the cycle lane is blocked by a sign (photo attached) at the junction/roundabout of Underhill Road. Forces cyclists to get off bicycle in the road, cycle into traffic flow or go onto pavement, which is dangerous for pedestrians and cyclists. There needs to be a traffic light for the cyclists in addition to the traffic light at each entrance to the roundabout junction. Reported to TfL with reference number: FMS8287093 but informed that it is a Local Authority issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melford Road, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
